snippet.title: Thomas test \- Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia
snippet.description: The Thomas test (Hugh Owen Thomas well leg raising test) is a physical examination test, named after Dr. Hugh Owen Thomas (1834-1891), a British orthopaedic surgeon ...

snippet.title: Thomas Test | Special Tests | Hip | Orthopedics | Physical ...
snippet.description: In general it is used to check for hip flexion contractures; more specifically it tests for anterior or lateral capsular restrictions or hip flexor tightness.

snippet.title: What is the Thomas Test? - ACE Fitness
snippet.description: ACE Exercise Physiologist Mark Kelly discusses how to administer the Thomas Test, as well as what mistakes to avoid when performing the assessment.

snippet.title: Thomas Test \- ExRx
snippet.description: Instructions. Preparation. Lie supine on bench with leg extended beyond edge of bench (less than half of thigh on bench). Bring other knee of other leg to chest.

snippet.title: What Is the Thomas Test? - wiseGEEK
snippet.description: Orthopedic doctors, who focus on the musculoskeletal system, may use a Thomas test in an examination if they suspect the patient has a hip problem.
